channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-20044] Arrow Serde should pad char values and handle empty strings correctly
item.description: When Arrow Serde serializes char values, it loses padding. Also when it counts empty strings, sometimes it makes a smaller number. It should pad char values and handle empty strings correctly.
item.summary: Arrow Serde should pad char values and handle empty strings correctly

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
GitHub user pudidic opened a pull request:

https://github.com/apache/hive/pull/396

HIVE-20044: Arrow Serde should pad char values and handle empty strin…

…gs correctly (Teddy Choi)

Change-Id: Iaa4417056a6e2a88335ed0cd5436142e128009c6

You can merge this pull request into a Git repository by running:

$ git pull https://github.com/pudidic/hive HIVE-20044-branch-3

Alternatively you can review and apply these changes as the patch at:

https://github.com/apache/hive/pull/396.patch

To close this pull request, make a commit to your master/trunk branch
with (at least) the following in the commit message:

This closes #396

ATTACHMENT ID: 12933682 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build

teddy.choi ewohlstadter Second thoughts...

Do you need to write a variation of StringExpr.padRight that accounts for Unicode? Do other any other parts of your Arrow SerDe need to consider Unicode character length vs. byte length?
mmccline, I added a variation of StringExpr.padRight for unicode char padding in the serializer. Thanks for pointing.

-1 overall
